title: Scotch Creme Eggs are here and they look all sorts of incredible | Metro News
text:
Miranda Larbi for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:44 am (Picture: Vicki Griffiths/Instagram) 
It might only be February but the supermarkets are already heaving with easter eggs. 
There they are, wasting away in all their chocolate glory, months ahead of the big day. Mindbogglingly, calling a Prosecco 'extra dry' actually means it's quite sweet 
If only there was some way of helping out, using up all those lone little creme eggs before their sell-by dates run out. 
You want to buy a Cadbury’s Crème Egg six pack but don’t know how to justify the extravagance so far away from actual Easter. 
Well, my friend, help is at hand – for both you and those poor crème eggs. 
Because someone – at last – has invested a Scotch Crème Egg . A post shared by James Bland (@bigdaddybland83) on Feb 23, 2016 at 11:17pm PST 
A much better version of the sausage-egg-breadcrumb monstrosity, these bad boys involve a creme egg being surrounded by moist chocolate cake and buttercream before being rolled in molten chocolate and chocolate sprinkles. 
Have it as a breakfast, a snack, a pudding – the possibilities really are endless. 
Basically, you just have to make a brownie, let it cool and then mould a fistful around the egg. Then you melt a load of milk chocolate and dip your brownie ball in it before covering in sprinkles or cocoa powder. A post shared by Adam Phillips (@filps14) on Feb 28, 2016 at 11:51am PST 
Sure, it’s probably like eating a ball of cholesterol but then it’s probably not that different to eating an actual, horrible Scotch Egg. 
And damn, they sure do look good. 
Be still, my already aching arteries.
